tool.name: DownloadFeatColbyID
tool.displayname: Download Feature Collection by Asset ID

param.name: asset_id
param.displayname: Specify the feature collection asset ID
param.dialogReference: The asset ID could be found at the dataset information page. For example, ee.FeatureCollection('BLM/AIM/v1/TerrADat/TerrestrialAIM') loads the Google Earth Engine Image Collection by asset ID BLM/AIM/v1/TerrADat/TerrestrialAIM.

param.name: filter_props
param.dialogReference: Filter the feature collection by values of its properties. The user needs to select a property, an operation and a value to filter the feature collection. For example, "ADM2_NAME == 'Denver'" has the property name as 'ADM2_NAME', operator '==', and filter value 'Denver'. The user can apply as many filters as needed.

param.name: filter_dates
param.dialogReference:
The user can filter the image collection by starting and ending dates. The typical formats of date strings are listed below.

  1. Year only, '2020'

  2. Year and month, '2020-07'

  3. Year, month and date, '2020-07-01'

  4. Year, month, date, and time, '2020-07-05T06:34:46'

For more information, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-imagecollection-filterdate

param.name: filter_bounds
param.expression: Coordinates (Point) | Map Centroid (Point) | Polygon (Area) | Map Extent (Area)
param.dialogReference: Filter a collection by intersection with point or polygon geometry. Items in the collection with a footprint that fails to intersect the given geometry will be excluded.

param.name: use_coords
param.dialogReference: Use the coordinates in latitude and longitude as the point geometry.

param.name: use_poly
param.displayname: Choose a polygon as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Use the user-defined polygon as the geometry. If the polygon contains multiple parts, the full extent of the polygon will be utilized.

param.name: select_geometry
param.displayname: Select the geometry type to download
param.dialogReference: An ArcGIS Pro feature class can store only one geometry type per file. If multiple geometry types are selected, separate feature class files will be created for each geometry type. The file names will include the specified output name below, with the geometry type appended at the end, such as "output_file_name_Point", "output_file_name_Polyline", etc.

param.name: out_feature
param.dialogReference: Specify the output file name. Final output file name will have geometry type appended at the end.

param.name: load_feat
param.displayname: Load feature class to map after download
param.dialogReference: Check this box if the user wants to load the output feature class to the current map after download.

tool.summary: This script downloads the Earth Engine feature collection dataset to ArcGIS Pro feature class by its asset ID. The geometry types of the feature collection can be converted to the ArcGIS Pro geometry types: point, multipoint, polyline, polygon. Since ArcGIS Pro feature class does not allow multiple geometry types in the same file, the different geometry types will be saved into separate feature class files.

idCitation.resTitle: Download Feature Collection by Asset ID
